questions.question: The following staining techniques are correctly described, except?

answers.text: Mucicarmine stains the thick polysaccharide capsule of Cryptococcus neoformans pink red.
Malachite Green Stain stains the endospores of Bacillus cereus green.
India Ink stains the thick polysaccharide capsule of Cryptococcus neoformans pink red
Gram stain when used in Bacillus cereus shows gram-positive rods in chains.

questions.question: A 32-year-old woman from Tondo, Manila is admitted to the hospital due to a 2-day history of painless watery diarrhea approximately 10 episodes/day. She is tachycardic, febrile, with sunken eyeballs, wrinkled hands, and has poor skin turgor. Which is most consistent of the likely causative microbial agent for this case?

answers.text: The organism utilizes genetic exchange through bacterial transformation.
The organism utilizes genetic exchange through bacterial transduction.
The organism utilizes genetic exchange through bacterial conjugation.
The organism utilizes genetic exchange through vertical inheritance.

questions.question: As the emergency room physician on duty, what medications can you prescribe?

answers.text: Tetracycline 500 mg orally four times a day for 3 days
Ciprofloxacin 500 orally twice daily for 5 days

questions.question: The following microorganisms are correctly paired based on their oxygen requirements, except?
The following superantigens are elaborated by Staphylococcus aureus, except?

A 31-year-old woman presents to your clinic with complaints of urinary frequency, pelvic discomfort, urgency, and vaginal discharge. She notes her symptoms started after her first coitus and denies any other symptoms. Urinalysis shows sterile pyuria. Urine culture has no growth after 24 hours of incubation with MacConkey Agar. Which of the following is TRUE of the presumptive microorganisms in this case?

answers.text: Budding yeast cells with pseudohyphae, (+) germ tube test
Gram-negative, obligate aerobe, oxidase positive, (+) IgA protease

questions.question: The following microorganisms are correctly paired based on their culture media, except?

A58-year old diabetic man complains of right thigh pain and limited mobility for nearly 2 weeks. On examination, there is a 10x10 cm fluctuant mass with purulent discharge. Microbial culture of the discharge revealed vancomycin-resistant Enterococci. Which of the following is most consistent with its mechanism of resistance?

answers.text: Production of Extended Spectrum Beta- Lactamase
Overproduction of the target site of the drug

questions.question: As the physician on duty, what is the appropriate management for this case?

answers.text: Admit, start patient on IV Ceftriaxone
Admit, start patient on IV Roxithromycin
Admit, start patient on IV Aztreonam
Admit, start patient on IV Linezolid

questions.question: Relating to the case above, in what bacterial growth phase would antibiotics in general be most effective?

An unknown isolate is presented to you with the following characteristics on blood agar plate: non- pigmented colonies, non-hemolytic pattern, gram positive cocci in clusters, catalase positive, coagulase negative, novobiocin resistant. Which bacteria is most consistent with these characteristics?

A 41-year-old female with known infective endocarditis is currently being admitted for acute pyelonephritis and further develops urosepsis. Indwelling urinary catheter tip cultures revealed the following characteristic: Gram (+) cocci in short chains, Catalase (-), gamma-hemolytic pattern, growth on NaCl 6.5%, PYR (+), and Bile-Esculin (+). Which bacteria is most consistent with these results?
Which of the following microorganisms is the most common cause of subacute bacterial endocarditis?
Which of the following is not true of Bacillus anthracis?

answers.text: B subunit of anthrax toxin is toxic to endothelial cells
Aerobic, gram (+), box-car like rods, non- motile
Anthrax toxin has two alternate A subunits
Inhalational form of anthrax has 100% mortality rate

questions.question: A 51-year-old male was admitted due to progressive weakness, dry mucous membranes, constipation, and worsening dysphagia. On examination, the patient is afebrile, MSE intact and with proximal muscle weakness of upper extremities. Which of the following microorganisms may cause such presentation?
In generalized tetanus, toxin degradation expected after how many weeks?
Which of the following is the susceptibility test for Corynebacterium Diphtheriae?

A 29-year-old G3P2 mother was admitted at the ER for fever and decreased sensorium. On microscopy of CSF, gram (+) mostly intracellular bacilli were seen. Culture on 5% sheep agar revealed a characteristic narrow zone of beta-hemolysis. Which of the following is most likely the organism in question?
Which of the following is not true of Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae?

answers.text: Erythromycin therapy stops toxin production better than cell wall active agents.
Gram positive rod; catalase, oxidase, and indole negative. H2S (+)
Ersipeloid usually occurs on the fingers at the site of a cut or abrasion.
Erysipeloid is also called whale finger.

questions.question: A 21/F presents to your clinic with fever, dyspareunia, and suprapubic tenderness. On history taking, your patient admits to having 5 sexual partners, (+) IUD for contraception. PE reveals hard, non-tender swelling with yellow purulent discharge on the right inguinal region.  Anaerobic culture on brain-heart infusion agar revealed “molar tooth colonies”. What is the likely culprit of microorganism in this case?
What is the drug of choice for the case above?

answers.text: Prescribe Metronidazole 500 mg PO BID x 7 days
Prescribe Penicillin G IM x 6 months

questions.question: A 30/M presents with cough, fever, altered sensorium, and non-bloody diarrhea. On urinalysis, RBC 5-9/HPF, protein 2+.  Serum Na 130 mEq/L, K 3.7 mEq/L, Cl: 101 mEq/L. Which of the following is the most likely causative agent?

A microbiologist noted blue-green colonies with a corn-taco like odor on cetrimide agar from a specimen of a burn patient. He is considering Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which of the following features best represent the bacteria?

answers.text: non-lactose-fermenting, gram negative rods; non-motile, oxidase negative, H2S non producer
gram-negative rods, motile, oxidase negative, H2S producer
non-lactose-fermenting, gram negative rods; swarming, oxidase negative, H2S producer, urease
non-lactose-fermenting, gram negative rod; oxidase positive, H2S non producer, obligate aerobe

questions.question: Which infectious agent is most associated with Guillain-Barre Syndrome?

A 23/M presents to your clinic with complaints of urethral discharge and discomfort. A NAAT test was done which was negative for both Neisseria gonorrhoeae and Chlamydia trachomatis. Which of the following is the most likely agent in this case?

Which of the following antibiotics has the weakest association with the development of C difficile– associated disease?
Which of the following represents the most common bacterial cause of COPD exacerbation?

A 18/M patient presents to the ER with complaints of migratory periumbilical pain to the RLQ, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and a temperature of 37.9. On examination, you note direct and rebound RLQ tenderness, with an Alvarado score of 7 points, your assessment is probable appendicitis. Exploratory laparotomy was performed, intraoperatively, the appendix appeared relatively normal with numerous palpable meso-appendiceal lymph nodes. Which of the following will you suspect as an infectious cause?
The following are viruses that have circular DNA except?
The following viruses are classified under herpesviridae, except?
The following viruses are classified under paramyxoviridae, except?
The following viruses require its own RNA- dependent polymerase for the transcription of negative strand, except?
The following microorganisms are correctly paired with their inclusion bodies except?

A 35/F presents with complaints of diffuse arthralgias and morning stiffness in her hands, knees, and wrist. She recalls 10 days prior of having lacy-reticular rashes on her face and extremities accompanied by fever, cough, and coryza. On examination bilateral PIP, MCP, and wrists are warm and tender to touch. Which of the following is the most likely infectious cause?
Which of the following viral genetic mechanisms will have no genetic exchange?
Which of the following statements is false regarding chikungunya?

answers.text: Chloroquine is prescribed for refractory arthritis
Migratory monoarthritis is a clinical feature
Aedes aegypti is the most common vector in urban areas

questions.question: Which of the following is a member of the Picornaviridae family?
The following viruses have a segmented genome, except?

A 51 year-old Nigerian man presents to your clinic with complaints of a 7-day history of fever, chills, skin rash, fatigue, and body-aches. He noted a skin rash on his chest days prior and admits to engaging in game hunting on the weekends. On examination, the patient has a temperature of 38°C. You noted cervical and axillary lymphadenopathy, multiple umbilicated and vesicular skin lesions primarily distributed over the face and extremities. Which of the following is your primary consideration?

answers.text: You noted cervical and axillary lymphadenopathy, multiple umbilicated and vesicular skin lesions primarily distributed over the face and extremities. Which of the following is your primary consideration?

questions.question: The following statements are NOT true of human immunodeficiency virus, except?

answers.text: gp41is the major antigenic determinants that elicit neutralizing antibodies
CD4 Lymphocyte count predicts risk of subsequent AIDS
Risk of transmission is lower compared to HCV from needle stick injuries
Attachment to lymphocytes is mediated CCR5 chemokine receptor

questions.question: For numbers 46-48, refer to the following case: A 27/M from Occidental Mindoro presents with altered sensorium, nuchal rigidity, and recurrent episodes of severe headache, fever and chills every 2 days. Complete blood count revealed fine blue ring-like protozoans with chromatin dots within red blood cells. What is likely the causative agent?
What is the main biological vector of this protozoan in the Philippines?
As the physician on duty, what will you prescribe for this patient?

For numbers 49 and 50, refer to the case below: A 16/M from Sorsogon presents to your OPD clinic with chronic dry cough. He admits to having been lost to follow-up 2 months prior, no antibiotics taken. On review of previous laboratories, you note pulmonary infiltrates in RUL fields. A repeat CXR reveals pulmonary infiltrates now in the left lower lung fields. CBC reveals absolute eosinophilia. If this case was related to an intestinal nematode infection, what would your consideration be?
In relation to the case above, which parasite would you LEAST suspect?

The patient was diagnosed with intestinal amoebiasis 2 weeks prior, however, was not fully compliant with the prescribed metronidazole and iodoquinol. Which of the following best represents the gold standard test for the patient’s condition?

Which of the following is not characteristic of Babesia microti?

answers.text: Maltese cross formation is a pathognomonic feature

answers.text: Round oval-shaped, (+) oncosphere, (+) bipolar thickenings, (-) striations
Oval/peanut-shaped eggs with striated shells and flattened bipolar plugs
Japanese lantern-like egg, (+) bipolar plugs, (-) striations on eggshell
Oval-shaped, 16-64 celled embryo, (+) thin hyaline shell

On examination, you note distended abdomen, (+) fluid wave test, dullness on percussion of traube’s space, and prominent superficial epigastric veins. If this was due to an infectious cause, what would your primary impression be?

answers.text: A 36-year-old man with HIV initiated HAART therapy 12 months ago when his CD4 count was 100/μL and now has a CD4 count of <250 /μL for the last 2 months.
A 21-year-old man with asthma receiving 40 mg of prednisone for an acute exacerbation, currently with a CD4 count of <200/μL.
A 39-year-old man with newly diagnosed HIV and a CD4 count of <100 /μL.
A 17-year-old man with HIV initiated on HAART therapy 1 month ago and now has a CD4 count of <50 /μL..

questions.question: A 24/M patient presents to your clinic with complaints of hair loss. On examination, you note circular bald patches with short hair stubs and broken hair within hair follicles. Yellow fluorescence was noted under wood’s lamp. Samples were taken for culture; colony morphology was white cottony surface and a deep yellow color on reverse; the thick-walled macroconidia with curved tips. Which of the following is the most likely causative agent?

For numbers 83-84, refer to the case below: A 65-year-old man with AIDS (CD4 count 45 cells/mm³) presents with acute onset fever, dyspnea, and a non-productive cough. CXR shows diffuse interstitial infiltrates. BAL reveals intracellular oval, budding yeast with a narrow base. Silver stain is positive. Blood culture was positive for the organism. What is the most likely organism?
Which of the following medications will you prescribe?

For numbers 85-87, refer to the following case: A 58/F, known asthmatic, presents to your clinic a 2- week history of cough and low-grade fever. On auscultation you note diffuse bilateral wheeze. CBC revealed eosinophilia. CT-scan showed homogenous dense round opacity in the right upper lobe, movable on dependent position, and (+) air crescent sign. Bronchoscopic biopsy of the lesion wall showed numerous septate hyphae branching in acute angles within the blood vessel endothelium. What is your primary impression?
Which of the following is the most common causative agent associated with this case?

A 55-year-old man is a farmer from  Africa. He developed a persistent scaly papule on his leg. Ten months later a new crop of wart-like purplish scaly lesions appeared. These lesions slowly progressed to a cauliflower-like appearance. Microscopic examination revealed melanized spherical sclerotic bodies. What is your primary impression?

answers.text: Sporotrichosis For cases 91-92, refer to the following case: A 75-year-old woman complained of left hand pain and swelling after 1 week after tending her yard. On examination you note a purulent abscess surrounded by granulomatous material was found. Sections of the tissue and subsequent culture showed hematoxylin and eosin-stained tissue; the asteroid body consists of a central basophilic yeast cell surrounded by radiating extensions of eosinophilic material.

questions.question: What is your primary impression?

answers.text: Disseminated disease is treated with Itraconazole.

answers.text: Tertiary syphilis is a reactivation of latent infection
Tertiary syphilis is a hypersensitivity reaction to the organisms
Tertiary syphilis is a chronic infection

questions.question: A 45/M presented with a 3-day history of fever, chills, and myalgia associated with mild cough and sore throat. He also noted onset of photophobia which prompted consultation at a local hospital. On further history, he declared a recent travel on a cruise ship. The likely causative agent of his illness can be grown on which culture medium?

answers.text: Upper lung lobe infiltrates with pleural effusion

answers.text: Direct microscopy with thin or thick smears

questions.question: A woman presented with vaginal discharge. On evaluation, you noted a thick, white frothy discharge at the introitus and multiple erythematous lesions in the vulva. The pH of the discharge is normal. What is the most likely causative agent?

answers.text: None, this is considered normal discharge

questions.question: A 57/M was rushed to the ER due to neurologic deficits and seizures. Upon stabilization, PE was done which revealed a positive Romberg test. answers.text: Friable, bulky destructive lesions containing fibrin, inflammatory cells, and organisms
Leaflet thickening, commissural fusion and shortening, and thickening and fusion of the tendinous cords
Small sterile thrombi on the leaflets of cardiac valves
Small or medium-sized sterile vegetations on either or both sides of the valve leaflets

questions.question: The following are TRUE regarding the treatment in HIV infection, EXCEPT?

answers.text: Highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) can suppress viral replication to below limits of detection in plasma
HAART allow the recovery of immune responses to opportunistic pathogens
HAART provides cure of HIV infection
